docTitle.titlePart:
Z009 Broadband Seismic Methods for Towed-streamer
Acquisition

front.div:
SUMMARY
One of the limiting factors in seismic resolution for marine towed-streamer acquisition is the ghost effect
due to sources and receivers. The ghost is the reflection from the sea surface that interferes constructively
or destructively with the primary reflections reducing the seismic bandwidth at the low end and the high
end of the spectrum. Different acquisition and processing solutions were proposed during the years to
address the ghost problem. In this paper we review these solutions and we introduce new slant streamer-
type acquisition with the processing based on prestack single-streamer deghosting.
